original: “Kiṁ nu jātiṁ na rocesi,🔽jāto kāmāni bhuñjati;
analyzed: kim nu jātim na rocesi  jātaḥ kāmāni bhuñjati
translated: Why don’t you approve of birth?🔽One who is born enjoys sensual pleasures.
so that you won’t regret it later.
For one who is born, there is death,

analyzed: hattha pādāna chedana  vadha bandha pariklesa
translated: the cutting off of hands and feet,🔽the distress of being killed and bound.
One who is born goes to suffering.
There is one born in the Sakyan family,
the transcending of birth.🔽Suffering, the origin of suffering,
leading to the stilling of suffering.
I lived happily in his teaching.
and the mass of darkness has been shattered.
